document_title: Primary infertility: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
1. In men
Signs of primary infertility in men include:
Pain during ejaculation, semen mixed with blood; Swelling in the scrotum, round like a ball, tender on one or both sides; The testicle is twisted or not in the correct position in the scrotum.; The testicles are swollen, painful, and red due to severe epididymitis or testicular torsion, preventing blood from moving to nourish the testicles.; Men with sexual dysfunction; Pain along the urinary tract or pus flowing from the opening (urethral opening).
Men can recognize the signs of infertility through systemic symptoms such as hair loss, belly fat, dry and wrinkled skin, excessive sweating, severe stress, always feeling anxious and restless...
2. In women
Primary infertility in women is difficult to recognize in cases where the cause cannot be determined. Below are common signs:
Menstrual disorders: Amenorrhea, menorrhagia lasting more than 10 days; Dysmenorrhea, menstruation is too light, menstruation only lasts for 2-3 days and then stops completely, menstruation is black and clotted...; Body fatigue: Women are always tired, in a state of obesity or too thin, with pale or yellow skin, headaches, dizziness... Although this is not the main sign of infertility, it is a symptom. of diseases that affect fertility in women such as liver disease, kidney disease, cardiovascular disease, endocrine disease...; Have regular sex without getting pregnant: Both husband and wife do not have any of the above symptoms, have regular intercourse 2-3 times/week, do not use any contraceptive methods for a while but still not pregnant.
